plantsites.name: Gardening is My Therapy
plantsites.description: I don't need therapy I talk to my plants. Tips to efficient gardening.

plantsites.name: Pothead
plantsites.description: How to plant indoor and outdoor plants in pots.

plantsites.name: I Wet My Plants
plantsites.description: The right way to water your plants.

comments.text: I love this app! My black thumb is now green. I feel like a plant expert in just a few clips of learning a few tips.
comments.author: Morgan Leach

comments.text: My yard is finally beautiful and full of vibrant colors thanks to the insight I gained from Flower Power app.
comments.author: Diane Blake

comments.text: All of my poor succulent babies were dying one by one before I understood how much and how often I should water them correctly. Now I am proud to say they are all thriving
comments.author: Summer Hatton

comments.text: A wonderful place to reconnect with nature is in my own garden thanks to Flower Power app.
comments.author: Josh Dunn

comments.text: I have finally mastered caring for my Fiddle Leaf Fig tree!
comments.author: Angelina Rupert

comments.text: Plant shopping has never felt more fun knowing that my new green friends will finally hang around longer than a few months.
comments.author: Brandon Miles

comments.text: I tried everything when it came to fertilizing my plants without harming them and I have finally learn what works best for my vegetables and it is organic and easy on my wallet thanks to Flower Power.
comments.author: Paris Mutan

comments.text: A wonderful place to reconnect with nature is in my own garden thanks to Flower Power app.

partners.name: How to Tell When it’s Time to Water your Plants
How much to water your plant?
partners.description: When it’s time to water, don’t be scared to give your plant a good thirst-quenching soak.

partners.description: The most common signs of an overwatered plant.
